education.degree: Bachelor of Applied Science in Engineering Science, Specialization in Robotics

experience.company: Department of Computer Science, University of Toronto, Vector Institute
description: Investigating morality alignment of LLMs through jailbreaking techniques and red-blue teaming
Probing latent space embeddings to analyze LLM reasoning behaviour
Collaborating with a team of 3 researchers to design and conduct experiments
Developed automated test scripts in Python to validate GPU hardware functionality, reducing manual testing time by 30%
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve hardware issues, improving overall product quality
Conducted performance analysis and optimization of GPU components, resulting in a 15% increase in processing speed
Documented test procedures and results, ensuring compliance with industry standards
Participated in design reviews and provided feedback on hardware specifications and test plans

projects.name: Peashooter Robot
description: Designed and built a robot capable of shooting peas at targets using computer vision for target detection
Implemented control algorithms in Python to accurately aim and shoot peas
Utilized OpenCV for real-time image processing and target tracking

projects.name: TurtleBot3 Autonomous Navigation
description: Developed an autonomous navigation system for a TurtleBot3 robot using ROS and Gazebo
Implemented SLAM and path planning algorithms to enable the robot to navigate through unknown environments
Tested and validated the system in simulation and real-world scenarios
